Q_DESC:
A cube has a side of 18 cm.
(a) Determine the radius of a sphere that has the same surface area as the cube.
(b) Determine the radius of a sphere that has the same volume as the cube.

Surface area of cube = 6a^2
Surface area of Sphere (SA)= 4(pi)r^2
Radius of the sphere (r) = sqrt((SA/4(pi)) 

Volume of cube = a^3
Volume of Sphere = 4/3 (pi)r^3
Radius of sphere = (3V/4(pi))^1/3
The input format is Enter the side of the cube :
TESTCASE_1:
6
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
Part A
SA = 216
Radius = 4.15
Part B
Radius = 3.72
TESTCASE_3:
13
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
Part A
SA = 1014
Radius = 8.98
Part B
Radius = 8.06
